page.title: 05CIDER MAKING
page.content: The best{cider}is made from bitter sweet apples. Apples are grown with the help of the bees that polinate the blossom. When the apples are ripe they are picked and put in a bowl shaped container with a conveyor belt which takes them up to the mill to be {crushed.}Then they are called{pulp.}It is then wrapped in nylon cloth with wooden slatted racks on top and another cloth on top and so on. When there are 14 to 16 layers the{cheese as it is now called is put into a press and all the juice is squeezed out. It goes into an underground tank that holds about 1000 gallons of juice. Then it is pumped into wooden casks to ferment. The yeast turns the sugar into alcohol. Then the cider is filtered and put into jars. Then it is sold. It can be dry or sweet. Dry cider can be called{"scrumpy".
